headline: KKR Expands Across Education Healthcare And Infrastructure As Shares Face Pressure
summary: KKR is acquiring a controlling stake in Southeast Asia’s XCL Education Holdings in a deal valuing the business at about $1.3b. Portfolio company Global Medical Response is preparing for a U.S. IPO. KKR is also in the running for new deals in India’s pharmaceutical sector and Australia’s smart metering business. For investors watching NYSE:KKR, these moves come after a mixed share price pattern. The stock closed at $92.19, with returns of 69.4% over 3 years and 107.9% over 5 years. This is...

headline: The global M&A boom is rolling into 2026 as AI sparks deal frenzy — but cash is getting tight
summary: Markets are betting that the global M&A surge has not yet finished, as Wall Street recovered its appetite for large-scale financings.

headline: Yardeni Pushes Back On Citrini's AI Apocalypse, Keeps S&P 500 10,000 Target In Play
summary: Ed Yardeni pushes back against Citrini Research's AI apocalypse scenario, arguing AI will boost productivity — not destroy jobs — while keeping his S&P 500 10,000 by 2030 target intact.

headline: Dow Jones Falls As Fictional AI White-Collar Wipeout Tale Strikes A Nerve
summary: American Express and other financial stocks dragged the Dow Jones Industrial Average and S&P 500 lower on Monday as investors reacted to a bleak 2027 AI-driven recession scenario published by Citrini Research, a firm that offers thematic and global macro trading ideas.  The firm says it's bullish on AI's potential and wonders about the economic implications if the impact is so far-reaching that it turns out to be bearish.  American Express, Capital One Financial, Blackstone Financial and KKR were among companies in Citrini's fictional write-up that were among Monday's biggest S&P 500 laggards.
